com.iasmar.rome.util

Class ViewUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iasmar.rome.util.ViewUtils

  • public class ViewUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Asmar on 01/7/2018.

    This Class provides utility methods to help Activities and Fragments load their UI.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • replaceFragment

        public static void replaceFragment(@NonNull
                                   android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                                   @NonNull
                                   android.support.v4.app.Fragment fragment,
                                   @IdRes
                                   int frameId,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String tag,
                                   @Nullable
                                   android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Replace the current view to the new one.
        Parameters:
        fragmentManager - The Fragment manager.
        fragment - The fragment.
        frameId - The frame id. The fragment is added to the container view with id frameId. The operation is performed by the fragmentManager.
        tag - Optional tag name for the fragment, to later retrieve the.
        bundle - the arguments supplied when the fragment was instantiated.

      • getColor

        public static int getColor(@NonNull
                           android.content.Context context,
                           @ColorRes
                           int resId)
        Get color by res id.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to use. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        resId - The desired resource identifier, as generated by the aapt tool. This integer encodes the package, type, and resource entry. The value 0 is an invalid identifier.
        Returns:
        A single color value in the form 0xAARRGGBB.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(@NonNull
                                         android.content.Context context,
                                         @StringRes
                                         int resId)
        Get string by res id.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to use. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        resId - Resource id for the string.
        Returns:
        The string data associated with the resource, stripped of styled text information.

      • setText

        public static void setText(@NonNull
                           android.widget.TextView textView,
                           @StringRes
                           int stringResId)
        Set text to text view by string res id.
        Parameters:
        textView - The text view that will be set the text to.
        stringResId - The resource identifier of the string resource to be displayed.

      • setText

        public static void setText(@NonNull
                           android.widget.TextView textView,
                           @NonNull
                           java.lang.String string)
        Set text to text view by string.
        Parameters:
        textView - The text view that will be set the text to.
        string - Text to be displayed.

      • makeToast

        public static void makeToast(@NonNull
                             android.content.Context context,
                             @StringRes
                             int resId,
                             int duration)
        Make a standard toast that just contains a text view with the text from a resource.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to use. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        resId - The resource id of the string resource to use. Can be formatted text.
        duration - How long to display the message.
